content:
Here is the information in a table format:

| Stakeholders Title | Stakeholder Type | Potential Benefit/Harm |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Rural communities in the 100 villages | Individuals | Benefit: Improved access to clean water |
| Local government and authorities | Government | Benefit: Improved public health and reduced burden on local resources |
| Water and sanitation organizations | Non-profit | Benefit: Improved access to clean water for rural communities |
| Health care providers and facilities | Business/Non-profit | Benefit: Improved public health and reduced burden on local resources |
| Agricultural businesses and farmers | Business | Benefit: Improved access to water for irrigation and farming purposes |
| Women and children who collect water | Individuals | Benefit: Reduced time and effort spent on collecting water |
| Schools and educational institutions | Non-profit | Benefit: Improved access to clean water for students and staff |
| Local businesses and industries | Business | Benefit: Improved access to water for industrial purposes |
| Landowners and residents who may be displaced | Individuals | Harm: Loss of property and displacement |
| Traditional water sources | N/A | Harm: Contamination or obsolescence of traditional water sources |
| Environmental organizations | Non-profit | Harm: Potential environmental impacts of the project |
| Local communities relying on traditional water sources | Individuals | Harm: Loss of traditional water sources for religious or cultural practices |
| Small-scale water vendors | Business | Harm: Loss of business due to the availability of running water |
